responses:
I wandered lonely as a cloud
That floats on high o'er vales and hills,
When all at once I saw a crowd,
A host, of golden daffodils;
Beside the lake, beneath the trees,
Fluttering and dancing in the breeze.

Do not go gentle into that good night,
Old age should burn and rave at close of day;
Rage, rage against the dying of the light.
Though wise men at their end know dark is right,
Because their words had forked no lightning they
Do not go gentle into that good night.

Two roads diverged in a yellow wood,
And sorry I could not travel both
And be one traveler, long I stood
And looked down one as far as I could
To where it bent in the undergrowth;
Then took the other, as just as fair,
And having perhaps the better claim,
Because it was grassy and wanted wear;
Though as for that the passing there
Had worn them really about the same.

How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.
I love thee to the depth and breadth and height
My soul can reach, when feeling out of sight
For the ends of being and ideal grace.
I love thee to the level of every day's
Most quiet need, by sun and candle-light.
I love thee freely, as men strive for right.
I love thee purely, as they turn from praise.

Shall I compare thee to a summer's day?
Thou art more lovely and more temperate:
Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May,
And summer's lease hath all too short a date:
Sometime too hot the eye of heaven shines,
And often is his gold complexion dimmed;
And every fair from fair sometime declines,
By chance, or nature's changing course untrimmed;
But thy eternal summer shall not fade
Nor lose possession of that fair thou owest;
Nor shall Death brag thou wander'st in his shade,
When in eternal lines to time thou growest:
So long as men can breathe or eyes can see,
So long lives this, and this gives life to thee.

The daughter grew up feeling unloved and eventually left home to find love elsewhere. She never spoke to her father again, and he died alone, regretting not showing her how much he loved her.

responses: For dinner, you can try making chicken parmesan. Coat chicken breasts in breadcrumbs and parmesan cheese, then bake until cooked through. Serve with pasta and tomato sauce.
If you want to make a pasta dish, you can try making spaghetti carbonara. Cook spaghetti and toss with eggs, parmesan cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
For a vegetarian meal, you can try making roasted vegetable quinoa bowls. Roast your favorite vegetables and toss with cooked quinoa. Top with a dressing of your choice.
For a quick and easy breakfast, you can make avocado toast. Toast bread and top with mashed avocado, salt, and pepper.
If you want to make a soup, you can try making tomato soup. Simmer canned tomatoes, vegetable broth, and spices together, then blend until smooth.
For a special dessert, you can try making chocolate lava cake. Mix melted chocolate with eggs, sugar, and flour, then bake until the edges are set but the center is still gooey.
If you want to make a homemade pizza, you can try making margherita pizza. Top pizza dough with tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, and fresh basil.
For a healthy salad, you can try making a kale salad with roasted sweet potato. Toss kale with roasted sweet potato, chickpeas, and a dressing of your choice.
For a meal prep dish, you can try making quinoa bowls with roasted vegetables and chicken. Cook quinoa, roast vegetables and chicken, and layer them in a bowl.
For a one-pot meal, you can try making chicken and rice. Sear chicken thighs, then cook rice in the same pot with chicken broth, vegetables, and spices.
If you want to make a chicken dish, you can try making lemon garlic chicken. Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then sauté with garlic and lemon juice.
For a gluten-free dish, you can try making zucchini noodles with shrimp. Spiralize zucchini into noodles, then sauté with shrimp and garlic.
For a curry, you can try making chicken tikka masala. Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices, then cook in a tomato-based sauce with cream.

responses: Photosynthesis is the process by which plants, algae, and some bacteria convert carbon dioxide and water into glucose and oxygen, using light energy from the sun.
An atom consists of a nucleus, composed of protons and neutrons, surrounded by electrons that orbit the nucleus.
DNA is a molecule that contains genetic instructions used in the development and function of all living organisms.

Mitosis is the process of cell division in which a single cell divides into two identical daughter cells.
Kinetic energy is the energy an object possesses due to its motion.

A gene is a sequence of DNA that contains instructions for the development and function of an organism.
Endothermic reactions absorb heat from their surroundings, while exothermic reactions release heat to their surroundings.
Enzymes are proteins that act as catalysts, speeding up chemical reactions without being consumed in the process.
Diffusion is the process by which molecules move from an area of high concentration to an area of low concentration.
Osmosis is the process by which water molecules move from an area of high concentration to an area of low concentration, across a selectively permeable membrane.

responses: One of my favorite books is 'The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy' by Douglas Adams. It's hilarious and has a great sci-fi storyline.
If you're looking for a classic, I highly recommend 'To Kill a Mockingbird' by Harper Lee. It's a timeless story that everyone should read.
If you want to read something inspiring, 'The Alchemist' by Paulo Coelho is a must-read. It's a beautiful story about following your dreams.
If you're in the mood for a mystery, check out 'The Girl on the Train' by Paula Hawkins. It's a real page-turner.
For a good sci-fi book, I suggest 'Ender's Game' by Orson Scott Card. It's an exciting and thought-provoking story about a young boy's journey to become a military leader.
If you want to read something funny, 'Bossypants' by Tina Fey is hilarious. It's a memoir that's both witty and insightful.
One of my favorite romance novels is 'The Time Traveler's Wife' by Audrey Niffenegger. It's a beautiful love story that spans across time.
If you're looking for a good historical fiction book, I recommend 'The Nightingale' by Kristin Hannah. It's a heart-wrenching story about two sisters in Nazi-occupied France.

If you're interested in reading about different cultures, 'The Joy Luck Club' by Amy Tan is a fantastic read. It's a beautiful story about the relationships between Chinese-American mothers and their daughters.
For a good thriller, check out 'Gone Girl' by Gillian Flynn. It's a suspenseful story with plenty of twists and turns.

If you're looking for a book that's been turned into a movie, 'The Hunger Games' by Suzanne Collins is a great choice. It's an exciting dystopian novel that's been adapted into a successful movie franchise.
One of my favorite books on my reading list is 'The Road' by Cormac McCarthy. It's a dark and haunting post-apocalyptic story that's beautifully written.

responses: Gardening is great! It's like playing in the dirt, but with purpose.
To grow tomatoes, you'll need a sunny spot with well-draining soil. Water them regularly, and give them plenty of room to grow.
Roses need regular watering and fertilizing, as well as plenty of sun. Prune them in the spring to promote new growth.
If you're a beginner gardener, try growing some herbs like basil, parsley, or mint. They're easy to grow and can be used in a variety of recipes.
Most plants need to be watered once or twice a week, depending on the weather and the type of plant.
The ideal soil pH for growing vegetables is between 6.0 and 7.0.
Try using natural remedies like neem oil, diatomaceous earth, or companion planting to keep pests out of your garden.
The type of fertilizer you use will depend on the type of plants you're growing. Look for a fertilizer with balanced NPK ratios.
To start a vegetable garden, choose a sunny spot with well-draining soil. Plan your garden layout and choose your crops. Make sure to water and fertilize regularly.
Good plants for shady areas include ferns, hostas, impatiens, and astilbe.
Use mulch to prevent weeds from growing in your garden. Make sure to pull out any weeds that do pop up.
To transplant seedlings, dig a hole in the soil and carefully remove the seedling from its container. Place the seedling in the hole, cover with soil, and water.
To keep your garden healthy, make sure to water and fertilize regularly. Prune plants as needed to promote new growth.
Good herbs to grow in a small garden include thyme, oregano, sage, and rosemary.
To prune fruit trees, remove any dead or diseased branches. Cut back any branches that are crossing or rubbing against each other.
Store your garden tools in a dry, clean place, and make sure to clean them after each use.
Good flowers to attract bees include sunflowers, lavender, wildflowers, and marigolds.
To grow succulents, choose a well-draining soil and a sunny spot. Water sparingly, and make sure to let the soil dry out completely between waterings.

responses: Make sure to research the company and the position beforehand so you can show your enthusiasm and knowledge during the interview!
Don't forget to dress professionally and arrive early to your interview.
Remember to make eye contact, smile, and have good posture during the interview!
Prepare answers to common interview questions, such as 'What are your strengths and weaknesses?' and 'Why are you interested in this position?'
Try to highlight your relevant skills and experience during the interview.
Practice good listening skills and ask thoughtful questions during the interview.
Avoid common interview mistakes such as speaking negatively about previous employers or not asking any questions.
Take deep breaths and remind yourself that you are qualified for the position and that the interviewer wants to see you succeed!
Research the company's mission, values, and recent news to show that you are invested in the company's success.
Send a thank-you email or note after the interview to show your appreciation and continued interest in the position.
Ask questions about the company culture, opportunities for growth, and the day-to-day responsibilities of the position.
Don't be afraid to ask for clarification or to take a moment to think before answering a question.
Use this opportunity to highlight your relevant experience and how it can benefit the company.
Remember to have a firm handshake, maintain eye contact, and avoid nervous habits like fidgeting.
Bring extra copies of your resume, a list of references, and any materials that may be relevant to the position.
Arrive about 10-15 minutes early to give yourself time to get settled and mentally prepare for the interview.
Make sure to show your interest in the position and the company by asking thoughtful questions and expressing your enthusiasm!
Use specific examples from your previous experience to demonstrate your skills and qualifications for the position.
Don't dwell on mistakes - instead, focus on what you can learn from the experience and how you can improve for future interviews.
End the interview by thanking the interviewer for their time and reiterating your interest in the position.

responses: Common car problems include flat tires, dead batteries, and engine troubles.
You should typically change your oil every 5,000 to 7,500 miles.
If your car won't start, check the battery, starter, and ignition switch.
To change a tire, first make sure you have a spare tire, jack, and lug wrench. Then, loosen the lug nuts, lift the car with the jack, remove the lug nuts, and replace the tire.
Signs that your brakes need to be replaced include squeaking, grinding, or a spongy brake pedal.
The best way to maintain your car is to follow the recommended maintenance schedule, keep it clean, and address any problems as soon as they arise.
To check your car's fluid levels, look for the dipstick or reservoir and use a clean cloth to wipe it clean. Then, reinsert it and check the levels.
The recommended tire pressure for your car can usually be found on a sticker inside the driver's side door or in the owner's manual.
If your car is overheating, turn off the AC and pull over to a safe spot as soon as possible. Let the car cool down before checking the coolant levels and calling for assistance if needed.
